lumis.portal.controller

Class ControllerHtml

  • java.lang.Object
    • lumis.portal.controller.ControllerHtml
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContentHyperLinkControllerHtml, ContentWizardControllerHtml, FCKSelectArticleControllerHtml, FCKSelectContentControllerHtml, FCKSelectDocumentControllerHtml, FCKSelectMediaControllerHtml, FileDownloadControllerHtml, FileDownloadControllerHtml, HyperLinkControllerHtml, ImportExportControllerHtml, LocalizationControllerHtml, LoginControllerHtml, MediaControllerJson, MetaDataInfoController, MultiFileUploadCheckControllerHtml, MultiFileUploadControllerHtml, NavigationLoggerControllerHtml, PageCacheControllerHtml, PagePersonalizationControllerHtml, PortalRequestParametersControllerHtml, PresentationControllerHtml, PrincipalControllerHtml, ProgressControllerHtml, SendToFriendControllerHtml, ServiceInstanceControlleHtml, ServiceInterfaceInstanceControllerHtml, ShowReportControllerHtml, StructureSyncControllerJson, UpgradeControllerHtml, URLAccessibilityEvaluationControllerHtml, WebsiteControllerHtml

    @StableMinor(version="8.1",
             sinceVersion="4.0")
public class ControllerHtml
extends Object
    This is the base class for all the controllers. Basic information like request, response and sessionConfig information is stored within local members. All controllers that return HTML should extend this class.
    Since:
    4.0.0
    Version:
    $Revision: 17593 $ $Date: 2015-07-17 11:21:36 -0300 (Fri, 17 Jul 2015) $

      • getRequestMode

        protected int getRequestMode()
                      throws PortalException
        Returns the mode for the current request. The mode is obtained analyzing the request.
        Returns:
        the current request mode. The value may be either PortalContext.MODE_ADMIN, or PortalContext.MODE_USER.
        Throws:
        PortalException

      • getCookie

        public String getCookie(String name)
                 throws ControllerException,
                        PortalException
        Deprecated. Since 4.0.7, use CookieUtil.getCookie(HttpServletRequest, String) instead.
        Given a cookie name, the cookie value if exists in the request object is returned. If the cookie is not found, a null value is returned
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        cookie value
        Throws:
        ControllerException
        PortalException
